enWisdom: Trustworthiness is [a sign of] faith; cheerfulness is [a form of] kindness
Trustworthiness is preservation [and safeguarding of what has been entrusted]
Trustworthiness is a success for the one who observes it
Trustworthiness is a merit for the one who executes it
Trustworthiness leads to truthfulness

Wisdom: الْأَمَانَةُ وَالْوَفَاءُ صِدْقُ الْأَفْعَالِ وَالْكَذِبُ وَالِافْتِرَاءُ خِيَانَةُ الْأَقْوَالِ
enWisdom: Trustworthiness and loyalty are sincere actions, lying and fabrication are perfidious utterances
The best [form of] trustworthiness is keeping one’s promise
he least of things [required for salvation] is truthfulness and trustworthiness
When trustworthiness becomes stronger, truthfulness increases

Wisdom: إِذَا أَحَبَّ اللَّهُ عَبْداً حَبَّبَ إِلَيْهِ الْأَمَانَةَ
enWisdom: When Allah loves a servant, he makes trustworthiness beloved to him

Wisdom: تَوَخَّ الصِّدْقَ وَالْأَمَانَةَ وَلَا تُكَذِّبْ مَنْ كَذَّبَكَ وَلَا تَخُنْ مَنْ خَانَكَ
enWisdom: Return the trust to the one who has entrusted it to you, and do not act treacherously with the one who betrayed your trust
The cornerstone of faith is trustworthiness
Sound trustworthiness is a symbol of good conviction
Espouse trustworthiness for it is the best [form of] religiosity

Wisdom: كُلُّ شَيْ‏ءٍ لَا يَحْسُنُ نَشْرُهُ أَمَانَةٌ وَإِنْ لَمْ يُسْتَكْتَمْ
enWisdom: Everything that is not fit to be disclosed is a trust, even if its confidentiality is not specifically sought

Wisdom: لِيَصْدُقْ وَرَعُكَ وَيَشْتَدَّ تَحَرِّيكَ وَتَخْلُصْ نِيَّتُكَ فِي الْأَمَانَةِ وَالْيَمِينِ
enWisdom: Let your piety be true, your striving for the right be intense and your intention be sincere in the trust [you take] and the vow [you make]

Wisdom: مَنْ عَمِلَ بِالْأَمَانَةِ فَقَدْ أَكْمَلَ الدِّيَانَةَ
enWisdom: One who acts with trustworthiness has perfected his religion
NULL
The best [sign of] faith is trustworthiness

Wisdom: مَنْ لَا أَمَانَةَ لَهُ لَا إِيمَانَ لَهُ
enWisdom: One who has no trustworthiness has no faith

Wisdom: لَا إِيمَانَ لِمَنْ لَا أَمَانَةَ لَهُ
enWisdom: There is no faith in one who is not trustworthy

Wisdom: لَا أَمَانَةَ لِمَنْ لَا دِينَ لَهُ
enWisdom: There is no trustworthiness in one who has no religion

Wisdom: أَدِّ الْأَمَانَةَ إِلَى مَنِ ائْتَمَنَكَ وَلَا تَخُنْ مَنْ خَانَكَ
enWisdom: Return the trust to the one who has entrusted it to you, and do not act treacherously with the one who betrayed your trust

Wisdom: أَدِّ الْأَمَانَةَ إِذَا اؤْتُمِنْتَ وَلَا تَتَّهِمْ غَيْرَكَ إِذَا ائْتَمَنْتَهُ فَإِنَّهُ لَا إِيمَانَ لِمَنْ لَا أَمَانَةَ لَهُ
enWisdom: Return the trust when it is entrusted to you, and do not accuse anyone when you entrust something to him, for surely one who is not trustworthy has no faith
When you entrust anyone [with something], then do not accuse them of treachery
The bane of trustworthiness is treachery
When you are entrusted with something, then do not betray [the trust]
Corruption of trustworthiness is submission to treachery

Wisdom: مَنِ اسْتَهَانَ بِالْأَمَانَةِ وَقَعَ فِي الْخِيَانَةِ
enWisdom: One who takes [the] keeping [of] trust lightly will fall into treachery
